intro: Trollius europaeus var. humilis, commonly known as the lesser crown flower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe. It features showy, yellow, saucer-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This variety is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks.
